q: Scared people want comfort and certainty so they avoid failure. People living fully seek challenges because this is where they feel alive.
h:
“Scared people want comfort and certainty so they avoid failure. People living fully seek challenges because this is where they feel alive.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.
h:
“There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.” —
Buddha

q: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
h:
“Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Distant water does not put out a nearby fire.
h:
“Distant water does not put out a nearby fire.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.
h:
“You know you are on the road to success if you would do your job and not be paid for it.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: In a world that is constantly changing, it is to our advantage to learn how to adapt and enjoy something better.
h:
“In a world that is constantly changing, it is to our advantage to learn how to adapt and enjoy something better.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: Your success and happiness lie in you.
h:
“Your success and happiness lie in you.” —
Helen Keller

q: When you are tempted to give up, your breakthrough is probably just around the corner.
h:
“When you are tempted to give up, your breakthrough is probably just around the corner.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.
h:
“There is no path to Happiness. Happiness is the path.” —
Dan Millman

q: The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.
h:
“The pain of parting is nothing to the joy of meeting again.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Words are the clothes thoughts wear.
h:
“Words are the clothes thoughts wear.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: The person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
h:
“The person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.
h:
“Winners are not afraid of losing. But losers are. Failure is part of the process of success. People who avoid failure also avoid success.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.
h:
“Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: You are the average of the five people you spend most time with.
h:
“You are the average of the five people you spend most time with.” —
Jim Rohn

q: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying, that he is wiser today than yesterday.
h:
“A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying, that he is wiser today than yesterday.” —
Jonathan Swift

q: When something comes from within, when it is a part of you, you have no choice but to live it, to express it.
h:
“When something comes from within, when it is a part of you, you have no choice but to live it, to express it.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Life is a question and how we live it is our answer.
h:
“Life is a question and how we live it is our answer.” —
Gary Keller

q: The trouble with most of us is that we'd rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.
h:
“The trouble with most of us is that we'd rather be ruined by praise than saved by criticism.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: We become brave by doing brave acts.
h:
“We become brave by doing brave acts.” —
Aristotle

q: Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.
h:
“Growth is in a series of mistakes. That's the only way you learn.” —
Steve Harvey

q: To live fully is to be always in no-man's-land, to experience each moment as completely new and fresh.
h:
“To live fully is to be always in no-man's-land, to experience each moment as completely new and fresh.” —
Pema Chodron

q: The fact of the matter is that there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest.
h:
“The fact of the matter is that there will be nothing learned from any challenge in which we don't try our hardest.” —
Josh Waitzkin

q: You are your best thing.
h:
“You are your best thing.” —
Toni Morrison

q: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
h:
“Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.” —
William James

q: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
h:
“Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow. ” —
Anne Wilson Schaef

q: The constant assertion of belief is an indication of fear.
h:
“The constant assertion of belief is an indication of fear.” —
Jiddu Krishnamurti

q: The sun is new each day.
h:
“The sun is new each day.” —
Heraclitus

q: You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
h:
“You can't stay in your corner of the Forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.” —
A.A. Milne

q: Cherish forever what makes you unique, cuz you're really a yawn if it goes.
h:
“Cherish forever what makes you unique, cuz you're really a yawn if it goes.” —
Bette Midler

q: Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas.
h:
“Believe in one thing too much and you have no room for new ideas. ” —
Ray Bradbury

q: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
h:
“Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.
h:
“Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.” —
Jack Butcher

q: The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.
h:
“The eye with which I see God is the same eye with which God sees me.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.
h:
“Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small.” —
Lao Tzu

q: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
h:
“He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.” —
Aristotle

q: If a thing is worth doing, it is worth doing badly.
h:
“If a thing is worth doing, it is worth doing badly.” —
Gilbert Chesterton
